summary: The Dependent Income Exclusion Act of 2025 amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude certain income earned by dependents when calculating modified adjusted gross income (MAGI) for eligibility for premium tax credits. Specifically, it excludes wages or self-employment earnings of dependents under 18 (or under 24 if in qualified programs) from MAGI calculations. Limitations apply, including a 15% MAGI threshold. The bill also includes conforming amendments and specifies the effective date for the changes.
